user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of connection_add_header:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
connection_add_header (void *cls,
                       const char *key,
                       size_t key_size,
                       const char *value,
                       size_t value_size,
                       enum MHD_ValueKind kind)
{
  struct MHD_Connection *connection = (struct MHD_Connection *) cls;
  if (MHD_NO ==
      MHD_set_connection_value_n (connection,
                                  kind,
                                  key,
                                  key_size,
                                  value,
                                  value_size))
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Not enough memory in pool to allocate header record!\n"));
#endif
    transmit_error_response_static (connection,
                                    MHD_HTTP_REQUEST_HEADER_FIELDS_TOO_LARGE,
                                    ERR_MSG_REQUEST_TOO_BIG);
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No suspicious fragments found. None of the function parameters (cls, key, key_size, value, value_size, kind) are assigned to or otherwise modified within this function. The code only: - reads cls and casts it to a local pointer variable (struct MHD_Connection *connection = (struct MHD_Connection *) cls;), which does not modify the parameter itself (it initializes a local variable). - passes parameters to MHD_set_connection_value_n and other functions and dereferences the connection pointer to access members. Modifying the object pointed to by a pointer parameter (e.g. connection->...) is permitted by the rule; the rule only prohibits changing the parameter variable itself. Therefore there are no fragments that need further investigation for Rule 17.8 compliance.
